div.p: Teaching/Instruction of the core of the mountain-oracle to be observed either during the ceremony horja Sita-sita, or people make us into datu during a great war, or people make us into datu in inaugurating a new settlement, or we are celebrating a marriage, or we are offering unhusked rice on the rice field for the feast-giving group, or we are bringing our child to the river, or during the porsahan ceremony of the man who died old, or during the magic warfare.

div.type: Invocations and enumeration of the datus through which the instructions have been handed down
div.p: So, observe the way in which our buffalo falls, in order that it will be known if we win the dispute, it will be known if we succeed, it will be known if we fail, from the words of our mountain-oracle here, said our Guru, Guru Agan ni aji oh!

So, let me teach it to you, O Guru Tumurun (descent) ni aji; so let it come to you, Guru Si Dupangon (helix-shaped leaves) ni aji, great wandering Datu who comes to the world of men, who takes care of the gold, the yellow one. Let it come to you, Oh Grandfather of Mangaleban of the marga Haro from the Sirait land; let it come to you Datu Panggual (musician) ni aji oh!
